metadata.description: Anti-Dumping (AD) and Countervailing Duty (CVD) tariff rates on crystalline silicon photovoltaic (CSPV) cells and modules imported into the United States
sources: US Department of Commerce — International Trade Administration
Commerce Department Preliminary and Final Determinations (2024-2025)
Presidential Proclamation on Section 201 Safeguard Tariff Extension
metadata.notes: Rates shown are combined AD+CVD where applicable. Actual rates may vary by specific exporter. These tariffs apply ON TOP OF Section 201 safeguard tariffs and any Section 301 tariffs. AD/CVD tariffs on SE Asian countries (Cambodia, Thailand, Vietnam, Malaysia) resulted from Commerce Department circumvention investigation initiated in 2022.

countries.products_covered: Crystalline silicon PV cells and modules

additional_tariffs.section_301: 50% on cells and modules (increased from 25% to 50% effective 2024-09-27)

countries.notes: Original AD/CVD orders from 2012. China also subject to Section 301 tariffs (trade war) and Section 201 safeguard tariffs. Effective combined tariff rate makes Chinese panels non-competitive in US market.
AD only (no CVD case). Applies to cells, not modules assembled in Taiwan. Taiwan cell manufacturing declining as production shifts.

countries.products_covered: Crystalline silicon PV cells and modules
countries.notes: Result of circumvention investigation. Commerce found Chinese companies routed production through Cambodia to avoid China AD/CVD orders. Some company-specific rates exceed 3,400% (New East Solar). Two-year moratorium on enforcement expired June 2024.

key_exporters.New East Solar: Up to 3,403.96% AD (highest rate in case)

countries.products_covered: Crystalline silicon PV cells and modules
countries.notes: Result of circumvention investigation. LONGi's Vina Solar subsidiary specifically found circumventing. Some rates effectively make Vietnamese panels cost-prohibitive. Combined with Section 201, effective tariff can exceed 800%.

countries.products_covered: Crystalline silicon PV cells and modules
countries.notes: Result of circumvention investigation. Trina Solar Thailand faces highest rates. Canadian Solar Thailand also heavily impacted.

countries.products_covered: Crystalline silicon PV cells and modules
countries.notes: Lower rates than other SE Asian countries but still significant. JinkoSolar Malaysia has company-specific rate. Hanwha Q Cells Malaysia has lower rate due to South Korean parent company transparency.

countries.products_covered: Crystalline silicon PV cells and modules
countries.notes: No AD/CVD orders on Indian solar products as of Feb 2026. India is a tariff-safe source for CSPV modules. Growing Indian manufacturing capacity (Adani, Tata, Vikram Solar, Premier Energies). Subject only to Section 201 safeguard tariff.

countries.products_covered: Crystalline silicon PV cells and modules
countries.notes: No AD/CVD orders. Hanwha Q Cells (South Korean parent) is major beneficiary of clean tariff status. Korean-made cells imported for US module assembly at Dalton/Cartersville, GA. Subject only to Section 201.

section_201.description: Safeguard tariff on ALL imported crystalline silicon PV cells and modules, regardless of country of origin. Originally imposed February 2018 under Section 201 of the Trade Act of 1974.
section_201.cell_tariff_rate_quota: 5 GW of cells exempt from tariff annually (tariff-rate quota)
section_201.extension_status: Extended by Presidential Proclamation 10790 (February 2024) for additional 4 years through February 2026. Further extension or modification expected.
exemptions: First 5 GW of imported cells annually (tariff-rate quota)
Thin-film panels (CdTe, CIGS) — not crystalline silicon
section_201.notes: Section 201 applies to ALL crystalline silicon imports from ALL countries (including allies). This is ON TOP OF any AD/CVD tariffs. Thin-film (e.g., First Solar CdTe) is exempt. The 5 GW cell TRQ allows some duty-free cell imports for US module assembly.

section_301.description: Section 301 tariffs on Chinese-origin goods, including solar cells and modules. Part of broader US-China trade dispute.

rate_history.2024_increase: 50% on solar cells and modules (effective 2024-09-27 per USTR review)

section_301.notes: Applies only to Chinese-origin goods. Does not apply to SE Asian countries (those are covered by AD/CVD). Combined with AD/CVD (45-265%) and Section 201 (14.25%), Chinese panels face effective tariffs of 100%+ making them non-competitive in US market.
